extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 heads baby bok choy, trimmed and roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: orange bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small yellow, red or orange bell pepper, diced

extendedIngredients.name: peanut butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup cashew butter or peanut butter

extendedIngredients.name: sriracha
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon Sriracha (Asian chile sauce), plus more for serving

extendedIngredients.name: sugar snap peas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 ounces sugar snap peas, trimmed and halved

recipes.title: Asian Noodles with Summer Vegetables

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook as the label directs, adding the snap peas and bok choy during the last 2 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, then drain. Transfer the pasta and vegetables to a large bowl.                          Meanwhile, pulse the cashew butter, 2 tablespoons each water and rice vinegar, the Sriracha, scallions, ginger, 1/4 cup cilantro and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor until smooth. Toss the bell pepper and radishes in a medium bowl with the remaining 1/4 cup cilantro and 1 tablespoon rice vinegar.                          Add the sauce to the pasta mixture along with enough of the reserved pasta cooking water to loosen; toss to coat. Top each serving with the diced vegetables and some Sriracha.                          Photograph by Charles Masters

steps.step: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the pasta and cook as the label directs, adding the snap peas and bok choy during the last 2 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, then drain.
Transfer the pasta and vegetables to a large bowl.

Meanwhile, pulse the cashew butter, 2 tablespoons each water and rice vinegar, the Sriracha, scallions, ginger, 1/4 cup cilantro and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor until smooth. Toss the bell pepper and radishes in a medium bowl with the remaining 1/4 cup cilantro and 1 tablespoon rice vinegar.
Add the sauce to the pasta mixture along with enough of the reserved pasta cooking water to loosen; toss to coat. Top each serving with the diced vegetables and some Sriracha.
